author: MyNameIsAbigail
content:
For the people who are studying:
Just the fact that you're right here means you're on the right track! Keep your focus and I know you'll be able to do it! Keep that chin up and that brain sharp.

For the people who are trying to sleep:
This is a reminder to put the gadget down and close your eyes. Save whatever is troubling you for tomorrow. This is a time for rest. Breath in and out
updatedAt:
and wait for that special slumber.

For the people who are relaxing:
Know that you are the best you can be
column4:
and that you should keep on striving! I believe in you and I love you <3.

Thank you so much for giving out support to random people

author: unadequated
content: To everyone who's studying with this music:

author: • A bottle of water
content: at least 1liter. Your brain works better if it has enough water and drinking helps you to concentrate💧

author: • Your charger. You sometimes don't even notice that your device's battery is going down
content: so better have it plugged in all the time🔋

author: • Your headphones. You will be able to focus more with headphones
content: because it blocks background noises. Also
updatedAt: if it's a late night study session

author: • a tea or coffee. Coffee keeps you awake
content: green or black tea can make you feel more awake as well.☕

author: • Your study/work stuff: your laptop/tablet/phone
content: a few pens

author: •Anything else you could need
content: what about a heat pad
column5: your pet so you have a study buddy 🐈

author: Reminder:After an hour
content: you should stand up and walk a bit around. Better stop the music or put on different music for the break. Open your window
updatedAt: even if it's cold outside. Fresh air will make it better

author: You could also lay your head down on your desk for ten minutes and listen to a podcast. Or
content: if you have to read a book
updatedAt: listen to the audiobook of it. You can also listen to the audiobook while doing another thing
column4: that's even better than listening to music while reading the book.

author: I hope y'all had a good day

author: Wanda Stilinski
content: If you're doing homework
updatedAt:
don't worry you will finish it just keep going ❤️

A few tips for studying:
📎Listen to this (ofc)
📎If you are sitting at a desk make it comfortable (blankets and pillows)
📎Clear a specific space
📎Have the window open (if it's cold only open it a tiny bit)for fresh air
📎Don't pressure yourself
📎It's ok to take a break ❤️
📎Stay hydrated
📎Have some food with you

Hope this helped ❤️
You got this!

author: Jennah Raja
content: To anyone listening to this while being stressed from school
column4:
or whatever it might be:

At times you feel like giving up
column5:
don't you?
You question yourself with "why am I putting in all this work and doing what I'm doing?"
column6:
right?
You have set such high expectations of yourself
column7:
haven't you?

It's so hard to focus especially since we are in the middle of a pandemic and at times we feel so unmotivated. You have so much to do and not enough time to do it. I get it. I feel you. It is not easy. It won't be easy.
While there are no shortcuts to completing your tasks or getting to your goals
column8: just remember I am here for you and we have got this. Do not put yourself down and beat yourself up over everything. You need to take breaks. In between each assignment or task reward yourself. Talk to yourself. Open your window or go sit outside for a few minutes. Just breathe. Then
column9:
begin your work again. You must take breaks and collect yourself. Write down your thoughts. Drink some water.

Just remember you aren't the only one and you aren't alone. If we are struggling let's struggle together and get through the obstacles.

You are loved. Thank you for being here.

Good luck to everyone. Your hard work will pay off in the end.

author: New Phone Who Dis
content: This inspired me a lot at 2 AM yesterday
updatedAt:
so here's the first out of the five poems I wrote. I hope you enjoy reading it along with the music ♥️

"A small moment in time"

For a small moment in time

I pause and wonder why

Look at the ceiling and stop thinking

Taking in the realization

That I'm still alive

And for a small second in time

I finally relax

And search for a way to walk

The peace and the quiet

I find myself to adore

The company of loneliness

Is right at my door

It gives me comfort

Keeps those sad thoughts at bay

I hope you will feel the same way

Take a deep breath

And relish in the fact that

You're still breathing

You're still human

The waves will wash away

All the sorrow and the bad

The good will come crashing

And will leave you in a trance

Because this place

Is where your heart's supposed to be

And this place

Is where you take the time

To pause for a moment in life

author: loser chips
content:
Things To Love About Life:

1. Meeting an old friend after a long time

2. Making a new friend

3. Receiving a compliment

4. Giving a compliment

5. Learning to play an instrument

6. Finding your passion

7. Warm blankets and fuzzy pillows

8. Adorable kittens and puppies

9. The smell of your favorite food

10. A new episode of your favorite show popping up

11. Being told "I'm proud of you."

12. Being able to talk to accepting people on the internet

13. Making someone's day better

14. Meditating

15. Learning to love yourself

16. Giving high-fives

17. Appreciating the effort you put into things

18. The taste of a smoothie on a hot summers day

19. The feeling of a job well done

20. Being in the middle of a great scene in a book

21. Finding an interesting videogame

22. Getting obsessed with that videogame

23. Drawing

24. Listening to music. Anytime. Anywhere

25. Finding a quarter on the street

26. Getting a nice cup of coffee

27. Learning more about someone you misjudged

28. Realizing there's so much to do in life

29. Being a part of a community

30. Do what you can to help the planet

31. Practicing positivity

32. Taking life one step at a time

33. The smell of a good wax candle

34. Fresh baked cookies

35. Achieving literally anything

36. Being close to a holiday so you can binge of way too much candy

37. Practicing mindful eating

38. Sewing

39. Trying something for the first time. Be it food or activity

40. Dancing with friends or alone

41. Having a crush on someone

42. Delighting in that feeling even if they don't like you back

43. Realizing they do like you back

44. More videogames!!

45. Writing a list of things you like to do

46. Handmade gifts

47. Taking a step towards your dreams

48. Proving people wrong for doubting you

49. Practicing patience and forgiveness

50. Loving people from all backgrounds and beliefs

51. Meeting someone amazing

52. Meeting someone that you idolize

53. Your room
updatedAt:
but clean

54. Trying to think of any Thanksgiving songs and failing

55. Remembering all your past teachers who were nice

56. Being happy that you have the right to get free education

57. Going to the gas station to get a frozen treat

58. Going to a state fair and having fun

59. Realizing how much you've improved as a person

60. Setting goals to improve as a person

61. Doing something you haven't done in a long time

62. Learning a new language

63. Learning anything positive

64. Warm showers/baths

65. Seeing someone cute

66. Having a nice conversation

67. Being around supportive people

68. Taking that step

69. Having a good sense of humor

70. Being a respectful person

71. Strive to be a positive role model for your generation

72. Loving on animal and plants

73. Telling inanimate objects to stop moving

74. Watching a funny or bad movie

75. Looking at some amazing art

76. Card games

77. Board games

78. Going to a new city

79. Decorating

80. Cats

81. Sunlight pouring through the windows

82. Writing

83. Finding a poem that you really connect with

84. Finding a person you really connect with

85. Hanging out with grandma/grandpa

86. Saying "I love you"

87. Being appreciated

88. Daydreaming

89. Looking back at old things you drew or made

90. Watching your favorite YouTuber

91. Starting a journal

92. Pretending you're in a movie

93. Actually being in a movie

94. The possibility that anything wonderful could happen to you

95. Realizing that you have the ability to make someone feel loved

96. Having someone to make you feel loved

97. Stepping away from suicidal thoughts and recovering

98. Rescue animals

99. Loving and seeing the value in all life

100. Being you
column4: the fact that you were blessed with the gift of even existing... is amazing. Whether you're cynical or positive
column5: whether lazy or opportunistic... know that whatever struggles you have
column6:
there's always a way to improve the situation.

101. You simply can't make a list of every little wonderful thing about life! There's way too many!

author: spidermonkey
content:
Imagine yourself on your own little tropical island.

No rules
column5:
and no worries.

You’ve just finished catching fish and you decide to make a little campfire and cook your fish on the beach.

And after a long day you return to your little cabin on the beach with your belly full.

You stare out to the ocean to see the beautiful sun set.

Than as you step inside your little cabin it starts to rain a little
column6:
and you could hear every single rain drop land on your roof and on the windows.

As you start to doze off about all those little random thoughts in your brain
column7:
you bring out your guitar and play some tunes.

After your creative mind starts to get tired
column8:
your body begins to relax.

You walk up to your room and lay down in a comfy bed and think about the plans for the following day.

(EDIT)
Thank you for all the positivity. Hope you guys have a good day/ night. Be safe out there and happy new year ❤️

author: My snowball
content: To everyone who's studying with this music:

author: • A bottle of water
content: at least 1liter. Your brain works better if it has enough water and drinking helps you to concentrate💧

author: • Your charger. You sometimes don't even notice that your device's battery is going down
content: so better have it plugged in all the time🔋

author: • Your headphones. You will be able to focus more with headphones because it blocks background noises. Also
content: if it's a late-night study session

author: • a tea or coffee. Coffee keeps you awake
content: green or black tea can make you feel more awake as well.☕

author: • Your study/work stuff: your laptop/tablet/phone
content: a few pens

author: •Anything else you could need
content: what about a heating pad
column5: your pet so you have a study buddy 🐈

author: Reminder: After an hour
content: you should stand up and walk a bit around. Better stop the music or put on different music for the break. Open your window
updatedAt: even if it's cold outside. Fresh air will make it better

author: You could also lay your head down on your desk for ten minutes and listen to a podcast. Or
content: if you have to read a book
updatedAt: listen to the audiobook of it. You can also listen to the audiobook while doing another thing
column4: that's even better than listening to music while reading the book.

author: I hope y'all had a good day
content: if not
updatedAt: that's okay too. Remember to take care of yourself and try to get some sleep tonight 😴🧸
